verses.kjv: And the word of the LORD came unto Jonah the second time, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD spoke to Jonah a 2nd time, saying,

verses.kjv: Arise, go unto Nineveh, that great city, and preach unto it the preaching that I bid thee.
verses.ct: "Get up and go to Nineveh, that enormous city, and deliver the message I tell you to."

verses.kjv: So Jonah arose, and went unto Nineveh, according to the word of the LORD. Now Nineveh was an exceeding great city of three days’ journey.
verses.ct: So Jonah got up and went to Nineveh, just as the LORD had told him. Nineveh was a remarkably large city — it took 3 days to walk across it.

verses.kjv: And Jonah began to enter into the city a day’s journey, and he cried, and said, Yet forty days, and Nineveh shall be overthrown.
verses.ct: Jonah walked into the city for one full day, calling out his message: "In 40 days, Nineveh will be destroyed!"

verses.kjv: So the people of Nineveh believed God, and proclaimed a fast, and put on sackcloth, from the greatest of them even to the least of them.
verses.ct: The people of Nineveh believed God. They declared a fast and dressed in rough sackcloth, from the most important people down to the least significant.

verses.kjv: For word came unto the king of Nineveh, and he arose from his throne, and he laid his robe from him, and covered him with sackcloth, and sat in ashes.
verses.ct: When the news reached the king of Nineveh, he got up from his throne, took off his royal robe, put on sackcloth, and sat down in ashes.

verses.kjv: And he caused it to be proclaimed and published through Nineveh by the decree of the king and his nobles, saying, Let neither man nor beast, herd nor flock, taste any thing: let them not feed, nor drink water:
verses.ct: Then he issued an official decree throughout Nineveh on behalf of himself and his officials: "No person or animal — not cattle or sheep — is to eat anything. They must not eat or drink water.

verses.kjv: But let man and beast be covered with sackcloth, and cry mightily unto God: yea, let them turn every one from his evil way, and from the violence that is in their hands.
verses.ct: Instead, every person and animal must be covered in sackcloth. Everyone must cry out urgently to God. Each person must abandon their wicked behavior and the violence they have been doing.

verses.kjv: Who can tell if God will turn and repent, and turn away from his fierce anger, that we perish not?
verses.ct: Who knows? Perhaps God will change his mind and pull back his burning anger so that we won't be destroyed."

verses.kjv: And God saw their works, that they turned from their evil way; and God repented of the evil, that he had said that he would do unto them; and he did it not.
verses.ct: When God saw what they did — how they turned away from their wicked behavior — God changed his mind about the disaster he had planned to bring on them, and he did not carry it out.
